alert.note: Alert for Caswell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 3:23AM EDT until August 22 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central North Carolina, including the following county, Caswell. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 323 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain falling from showers and storms. No flooding has been reported but 1 to 3 inches of rain since midnight with an additional half inch of rain will likely result in minor flooding. in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hyco River, Country Line Creek, Jordan Creek, Hughes Mill Creek, Panther Branch, Kilgore Creek, and Lynch Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Yanceyville... Prospect Hill... Hightowers... Topnot... Leasburg... Baynes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
